abstract: Arrest of Brazilian Sen Delcidio do Amaral and his chief of staff Diogo Ferreira Rodrigues on charges of trying to obstruct investigation into oil company Petrobras is tied to secret recordings made by Bernardo Cervero, son of former Petrobras exec Nestor Cervero; younger Cervero reportedly went undercover in attempt to help his father; event has shaken political establishment under Pres Dilma Rousseff, which whom Amaral was closely aligned.
lead_paragraph: Delcídio do Amaral, an ally of President Dilma Rousseff, was charged with impeding an investigation into Brazil’s state-owned oil company.

headline.main: Cellphone Recording Leads to Arrest of Brazilian Senator on Obstruction Charges
headline.print_headline: Secret Recordings Tied to Senator’s Arrest Stun Brazil’s Establishment

snippet: Delcídio do Amaral, an ally of President Dilma Rousseff, was charged with impeding an investigation into Brazil’s state-owned oil company.
